#Lothenbach et al., 2018 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cemconres.2018.04.018
#Cemdata18 database: Standard thermodynamic properties at 25 °C and 1 bar
#a0, a1, a2, a3 are the empirical coefficients of the heat capacity function: C°ₚ = a₀ + a₁ T + a₂ T⁻² + a₃ T^-0.5
#heat capacity functions for cement hydrates are typically valid up to 100 °C only.
#Cement shorthand notation is used: A=Al2O3; C=CaO; F=Fe2O3; H=H2O; M=MgO; S=SiO2; c=CO2; s=SO3;
